intro: Pleroma marumbiense, commonly known as the Marumbi bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Pleroma marumbiense is often found in coastal and mountainous areas, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
